key_points: House Republicans ousted Rep. Liz Cheney of Wyoming from her leadership post as conference chair due to her stance against Donald Trump's claims about the 2020 election.
The other nine House Republicans who voted to impeach Trump have faced backlash, including censure and primary challenges.
Adam Kinzinger of Illinois criticized the GOP's push to remove Cheney and has supported the other nine Republicans facing primary challenges.
Kinzinger launched a political action committee called "Country First" to counter the GOP's embrace of conspiracy theories.
John Katko of New York faced criticism from local GOP leaders for his impeachment vote but stood by his decision.
Fred Upton of Michigan was censured by local Republican parties for his impeachment vote.
Jaime Herrera Beutler of Washington was condemned by the state's Republican Central Committee but defended her vote.
Dan Newhouse of Washington does not regret his impeachment vote despite backlash from Trump supporters.
Peter Meijer of Michigan expressed concerns over the future of the GOP and the influence of conspiracy theories.
Meijer has been censured by GOP county groups and faces a primary challenge from Tom Norton.
